title.narrative: Real-Time Evaluation of the Danida Country Programme for Kenya

description.narrative: The Real-time Evaluation is seen as an evaluation approach, which from the start of the programme defines an independent, external evaluation process that follows the ongoing implementation and regularly reports evaluation findings. The focus will be on assessing the development in the programme context within selected thematic areas and assess progress towards outcomes so as to identify and support any programme adjustments needed, rethinking of theories of change and their assumptions, and continuous learning as well as on capturing selected (prioritised) results. The purpose of the specific pilot exercise in Kenya will be to gain experiences with the strengths and prerequisites and possible pitfalls of the RTE approach.
